topic.title: HP Helion 2.0 Development Platform: Continuous Integration and Deployment Overview

body.p: "Greenfield" software development provides new functionality for new infrastructure, new customers, new owners, or new ideas.
Writing enterprise apps in such an undefined arena is fundamentally risky, and best practice is to take an agile, iteritave approach.

With Continuous Integration and Deployment (CICD), small project teams can build, test, and deploy each functional iteration with little effort, allowing developers to focus on the code, not the process.

ul.li: Automates testing through integration with popular testing frameworks.
Supports Git version control technologies: Github.com, Github Enterprise, and on-premise Git repositories.
Deploy to any specified Helion Development Platform environment: test, staging or production.
Supports applications built on Node.js, Java, and Python.
Sends notifications to popular collaboration software such as HipChat and Flowdock.
Integrates with StormRunner for post-deployment load-testing analysis.
